str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
A handkerchief, napkin. Of Latin origin; a sudarium, i.e. Towel.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
An apron worn by artisans. Of Latin origin; a semicinctium or half-girding, i.e. Narrow covering.
The skin, surface of the body. Probably akin to the base of chraomai through the idea of handling; the body.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To carry, bear away (sometimes with violence). From apo and phero; to bear off.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From ek and poreuomai; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
